skills.name: Game Development (Adaptability)
skills.description: Making video games is practice in adaptability. I've learned parts of digital art, 3d modelling, rigging, animation (2D and 3D), graphic design, audio engineering, multiple game engines, frameworks and programming languages, and various ways to put them all together. It is a joyfully multidisciplinary nightmare.

skills.name: Accessible Design
skills.description: Developing BCI video games has given me unconventional insight into accessible development. In the future, I hope to expand this knowledge to more common areas, mainly web accessibility.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.description: Curl! was a year of planning, writing, doing, and team management. I learned so much about managing myself and others through numerous mistakes. I have practised these lessons and learned many more across many, many game jams.

skills.name: Peer Mentorship
skills.description: The University of Calgary Game Design club gave me the opportunity to learn from my peers and also to teach. I've spent countless hours guiding students through various tools and concepts across the many disciplines of game development.
